Steps to reproduce:

In my little laptop (screen 13.3) emails in text have always a too small size of font.


Actual results:

 I have to increase the size of the text with the shortcut Ctrl++ to read.


Expected results:

Thunderbird should remember my favourite size of text (for email in text) OR/AND should have an option to set the size of text for the body of email in text format.
comments.author: pierre.willaime@gmail.com

Expected results:

Thunderbird should remember my favourite size of text (for email in text) OR/AND should have an option to set the size of text for the body of email in text format.

(In reply to ppr from comment #0)
Agreed. Font size is only for HTML emails but it is not applied to text e-mails. I tried it and it only works through Control-+. I couldn't find a similar bug.
